name: CBC Syslog v1.3.1 - General Fixes
body:
## General
* Update to latest jinja2 package

## Bug fixes
* Rename parser file to prevent conflict on windows
* Reformat package to move files into a util subfolder

name: Python 3 support and various bug fixes
body:
# Changelog

## Version 1.3.0

**Breaking Changes:**
* Leef output has been rewritten to better utilize common properties and include as much information as possible
* Code and files have been refactored and renamed to better align with the product

**Bug fixes:**
* Config file no longer fails when output_format is leef
* Added Python 3 support with the addition of the python six package.
* Tests have been rewritten and additional tests around the config file have been added
* https_ssl_verify allows for false value

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS connector 1.2.12
body:
# Changelog 
* Added HTTP output and ability to add custom headers in the conf file
* Bugfix on http out and added test case for http_out on test server
* Fixing logging for test server
* Fixed an output formatting bug

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS connector 1.2.9
body:
Changes in this release:

* Fixed bug #17 - Unicode string encoding issues

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS connector 1.2.8
body:
# Improvements
* Added new json output_format type

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS connector 1.2.7
body:
# Bug Fixes
* Ensure only 1 instance can run at a time
* More consistency for timestamp fields

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS connector 1.2.6
body:
# New Features
* Added configurable severity for POLICY_ACTION events.

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS Connector 1.2.5
body:
# New Features
* Implemented store-forward.  If connection to the destination fails, then the connector will save the message and try to send later.
* timestamps are now localized to GMT

name: Cb Defense Syslog Connector 1.2.4
body:
# Changelog
* Forced SSL verification
* Better error messages during config parsing

name: Cb Defense Syslog 1.2.3
body:
# Change Log
* Changed crontab user from daemon to root
* Updated README

name: Cb Defense Syslog TLS 1.2.2
body:
# BugFix
* Fixed an issue where files were being placed at incorrect locations during rpm install

name: Cb Defense Syslog Connector 1.2.1
body:
Addresses #11 and #10 

# Bug Fixes
* Fixed bug where no message state would not send to all specified output addresses
* added newline to data to fix tcp and tcp+tls

name: Cb Defense Syslog 1.2.0
body:
## New Features
* Added configuration to account for UDP, TCP or TCP+TLS
* Added the ability to forward via UDP
* Rename to Cb-Defense-Syslog for clarity

name: Syslog connector 1.1.0
body: Add ability to disable TLS support
